abstract: Federal District Court Judge Kimba M Wood rules New York State's licensing exam for teachers does not discriminate against minorities, who tend to score poorly on exam, because exam evaluates skills necessary for job; ruling represents significant development in ongoing tensions between push for more rigorous teacher certification and push for more diverse school staff.
lead_paragraph: Even though minorities tended to score poorly on the test, the exam evaluated the skills necessary to do the job, a federal judge said.

headline.main: Judge Rules New York Teacher Exam Did Not Discriminate Against Minorities
headline.print_headline: Licensing Test for Teachers Isn’t Biased, Judge Rules

snippet: Even though minorities tended to score poorly on the test, the exam evaluated the skills necessary to do the job, a federal judge said.
